Dear Mr. Burnham:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Claudia Triestram at (616) 552-3662.

ALLEGATION:
On 1/18/21, youth and staff member engaged in a physical altercation at the facility
that involved LE. Staff member told youth to make their own food. Youth opened a
can of soup when staff member approached youth. Youth felt threatened and threw
the soup at the staff member. An argument ensued and staff member whipped or
threw soup back at youth. Youth then punched staff member in the face.
2

INVESTIGATION:
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on January 25, 2021. Youth
A said on January 18, 2021 Staff 1 was working. Youth A said he asked Staff 1 to
make dinner for all the youth in the house at 4:30pm and Staff 1 said no. Youth A
said he then went upstairs to his bedroom for a while. Youth A said he returned
downstairs around 6:30pm and asked Staff 1 to make dinner again. Youth A said
Staff 1 told him to make himself something as she was not going to make the whole
house dinner. Youth A said he was upset and told Staff 1 it is her job to make them
dinner and he wanted something to eat. Youth A said Staff 1 told him to make soup
and gave him a can of soup. Youth A said he opened the soup and told Staff 1 to
make it for him. Youth A said Staff 1 started to walk towards him in an aggressive
manner yelling at him, so Youth A said he took a step back. Youth A said Staff 1 got
really close to him and he splashed some of the soup from the can he was holding in
her face. Youth A said Staff 1 then grabbed the can of soup from him and threw the
can of soup at Youth A hitting him in the head and making the soup go all over the
kitchen. Youth A said Staff 1 grabbed him around the waist and he reacted by
grabbing Staff 1 in an “armbar” so she could not move and told her to get away from
him and let Staff 1 go. Youth A said Staff 1 then removed her glasses and wiped
away soup and then slapped Youth A in the face. Youth A said he was surprised that
he had just been hit and reacted by punching Staff 1 in the face. Youth A said Staff 1
continued to come towards him aggressively after he had punched her, so Youth A
said he put Staff 1 in a headlock and punched Staff 1 in the face several times.
Youth A said as he was punching Staff 1 she was punching and slapping Youth A
over his arm. Youth A said Youth B grabbed him from behind and pulled Youth A off
from Staff 1 and into the dining room. Youth A said he then went upstairs to “cool
off”. Youth A said he has never been physically disciplined while at North Point
Homes. Youth A said he does not like Staff 1 because “she is disrespectful towards
me”. Youth A said Staff 1 will often refuse to do something in the house or have a
negative tone when she comes in if something is bothering her in her personal life.
Youth A said Staff 1 will tell the youth about her personal life, giving examples where
Staff 1 told the youth about her boyfriend cheating on her, and being homeless.
Youth A said he always feels there is food in the house and something to eat if he is
hungry.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on January 25, 2021. Youth
B said that Staff 1 came to work on January 18, 2021 in a bad mood because she
was stressed about finding an apartment. Youth B said Staff 1 has come into work
several times feeling stressed about things going on in her personal life such as the
break-up with her boyfriend, going to jail because of assaulting the boyfriend’s
daughter, and not being paid enough from North Point Homes. Youth B said Staff 1
and he are very close, and she shares many things with him. Youth B said at 7pm
he was upset because Staff 1 was not making dinner. Youth B said he asked Staff 1
to make the dinner and Staff 1 told him to ask another staff. Youth B said there were
two staff there at the time, one was leaving and the other burns everything she
3

cooks. Youth B said Staff 1 asked Youth B to give her space and leave her alone
however Youth B said he did not do that and “had a fit demanding she cook me
food”. Youth B said Staff 1 told him to have soup, ramen noodles, or a hot pocket but
Youth B said he wanted the tater-tot casserole that was on the menu. Youth B said
he was yelling at Staff 1 in the kitchen when Youth A came downstairs and into the
kitchen screaming at Staff 1 to make him food too. Youth B said Youth A was calling
Staff 1 names and telling her she was not doing her job. Youth B said Staff 1 then
agreed to help Youth B find the tater-tots and help him make the meal, however
Youth A kept yelling at Staff 1. Youth B said Staff 1 then told Youth A to make soup
and handed him a can of soup. Youth B stated Youth A said, “you really want me to
make this soup” and Staff 1 said “yes”. Youth B said Youth A then opened the soup
an dumped the whole can over Staff 1’s head. Youth B said Staff 1 pushed Youth A
into the refrigerator and Youth A was pushing Staff 1 as well. Youth B said Staff 2
then walked into the kitchen telling both Staff 1 and Youth A to stop. Youth B said
Staff 1 was walking out of the kitchen and accidently bumped into Youth A at which
time Youth A grabbed Staff 1 and put her in a headlock and began to punch her over
and over in the head. Youth A said he then grabbed Youth B from the back and took
him into the dining room. Youth B said Youth A went upstairs and Staff 1 went into
the bathroom. Youth B denied ever seeing Staff 1 touch Youth A’s face. Youth B
said he has never seen Staff 1 physically discipline a youth. Youth B said Youth A
does not like Staff 1 because she enforces the rules of the facility.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on January 25, 2021. Youth
C said he was in the staff office with Staff 3 and Therapist when he heard yelling
from the kitchen. Youth C said Youth A was telling Staff 1 to make him food and
Staff 1 was telling Youth C to eat soup. Youth C said he saw Youth A dump soup on
Staff 1’s head and then Staff 1 “swing” on Youth A, hitting Youth A in the face. Youth
C said he saw Staff 1 “slapping and swinging” many times at Youth A. Youth C said
Youth B then grabbed Staff 1 and wrapped his arm around Staff 1’s neck and
punched Staff 1 in the head twice. Youth C said Youth B separated Youth A and
Staff 1 and the police were called to the house. Youth C said Staff 1 was very angry
with Youth A for dumping soup on her. Youth C said Staff 1 is normally very nice and
not an angry person. Youth C said Staff 1 was in a bad mood that day because she
was going through a break-up with her boyfriend. Youth C said there is always food
in the house, and he has never gone without a meal.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on January 25, 2021. Staff 1
said she has been a direct care worker at North Point Homes since March of 2020.
Staff 1 said on January 18, 2021 she arrived at the facility at 3pm for her shift. Staff
1 said when she got to the house the youth had a large pot of rice and chicken that
they had been eating all afternoon. Staff 1 said in addition to the rice and chicken the
youth also heated up hot pockets and ramen noodles between 3pm and 6pm. Staff 1
said all of the youth completed a therapy group around 6pm. Youth A went upstairs
with another youth and Staff 2, Youth B was walking around the house on the
4

phone, and Staff 1 and Youth C reheated leftovers and ate at the table. Staff 1 said
after she and Youth C finished their food, she was helping Youth C prepare for
shower time by getting Youth C’s shampoo and body soap. Staff 1 said while she
was doing this Youth B began to yell and demand she make him tater-tot casserole.
Staff 1 said she told Youth B to eat the leftovers in the refrigerator however he
refused. Staff 1 said Youth B then entered the kitchen screaming and yelling at Staff
1 to make him food. Staff 1 said she told Youth A to ask Staff 2 or Staff 3 to help him
and he refused. Staff 1 said Youth B asked her for the tater-tots and she began to
help him look in the freezer for them. Staff 1 said Youth A was given soup for dinner
and he opened it and was standing across the room from her. Staff 1 said Youth A
told Youth B to move because he was going to dump the soup on Staff 1. Staff 1
said she was standing by the refrigerator and Youth B moved to the table area while
Youth A came towards her and poured the soup over Staff 1’s head. Staff 1 said she
was trying to move out of the kitchen however was not able to see well because she
had soup in her eyes and was sliding around on the floor, due to the soup making it
slippery. Staff 1 said she then decided to get the soup can from Youth A and wiped
the soup off her face and playfully wipe the soup on Youth A’s cheek. Staff 1 said
Youth A then said, “did you see that? She slapped me!” and Youth B responded by
saying “I’m staying out of it”. Staff 1 said at that time Youth B grabbed Staff 1 and
put her in a headlock and began to punch her repeatedly in the face. Staff 1 said
Youth A then pulled Youth B off Staff 1 and she ran into the bathroom and locked
the door. Staff 1 said she called the police and was told by the police someone had
already notified them and an officer was on the way. Staff 1 said she came out of the
bathroom once she knew the police had entered the home. Staff 1 said the police
interviewed her and other staff and youth. Staff 1 said she wrote an incident report
on the matter and left the facility at 9:30pm. Staff 1 said she has not had issues with
Youth A in the past, however she knows that Youth A has “black-outs” when he gets
really angry and so she is not sure if he even remembers what he did to her. Staff 1
denied slapping or hitting Youth A’s face. Staff 1 said she has not had past
disciplinary action related to her tone or behaviors. Staff 1 said she was written up
once for “supervision” with the rest of the staff after a different special investigation.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on January 25, 2021. Staff 2
said she has been a direct care worker for two years for North Point Homes. Staff 2
said she worked the evening of January 18, 2021. Staff 2 said she was upstairs
supervising another youth when she heard a commotion in the kitchen. Staff 2 said
she went down to see what had happened and when she arrived in the doorway of
the kitchen, she saw soup all over Staff 1 as well as the kitchen. Staff 2 said Youth A
was standing behind Staff 1 and moved away as soon as Staff 2 was in the
doorway. Staff 2 said Staff 1 was by the dishwasher area and Youth A was near the
refrigerator. Staff 2 said Staff 1 and Youth A were yelling back and forth at each
other when Staff 1 “open handed smacked Youth A in the face”. Staff 2 said Youth A
had not made any type of aggressive movement towards Staff 1 but that he was just
verbally yelling at Staff 1. Staff 2 said once Staff 1 had slapped Youth A, Youth A
grabbed Staff 1 and put her in a headlock and began to punch Staff 1 in the head.
5

Staff 2 said Youth B grabbed Youth A from behind and pulled Youth A into the dining
room. Staff 2 said Youth A went upstairs and Staff 1 went into the bathroom. Staff 2
said the police were called and they arrived and took statements from staff and
youth. Staff 2 said she has not seen Staff 1 ever be physically aggressive towards
the youth however said Staff 1 will often engage in power struggles about following
rules of the facility with the youth. Staff 2 said the direct care workers are all trained
to “tap out” in situations like this. Staff 2 said Staff 1 should have taken a break in
either the staff office or outside and had a chance to walk away from the situation
instead of engaging like she did. Staff 2 said everyone in the house is aware of the
trauma that Youth A has about food as he was previously starved and therefore
having any type of power struggle with Youth A regarding food is going to “set him
off”. Staff 2 said Staff 1 does not exhibit good boundaries with the youth and will
often share a lot of her personal life situations with the youth in the house, such as
her break-up, and financial struggles.
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on January 29, 2021. Staff 3 said Staff 1
and Youth A were in the kitchen arguing about dinner and Staff 1 told Youth A to
have soup which he did not want, so Youth A went upstairs. Staff 3 said Staff 1 was
walking around the house getting shower supplies for Youth C. Staff 3 said she was
in the staff office and heard Staff 2 screaming “stop it”. Staff 3 said she left the staff
office and saw Staff 1 go into the bathroom and then back into the kitchen. Staff 3
said Staff 1 was standing by the stove and Youth A was leaning on the counter. Staff
3 said Staff 1 walked two to three steps towards Youth A and slapped Youth A in the
face. Staff 3 said Youth A said, “did you see that” and grabbed Staff 1 and punched
her in the face. Staff 3 said Youth B then grabbed Youth A and got him away from
Staff 1. Staff 3 said Youth A went upstairs with Staff 2 following him and Staff 1 went
into the bathroom and closed the door. Staff 3 said she went to the staff office to call
the police however Therapist was already on the phone with the police when she got
into the staff office. Staff 3 said she checked on all the youth and then went upstairs
and checked on Youth A. Staff 3 said Youth A had a red mark on his face from the
slap from Staff 1. Staff 3 said all direct care workers are trained to “tap out” in
situations such as this which would allow another staff to take over and the staff that
is struggling to get a break. Staff 3 said she believes Staff 1 should have tapped out
and not engaged in the situation. Staff 3 said Youth A has food trauma from being
starved and staff know not to argue with him regarding food. Staff 3 said it is also
known that when Youth A was given food it was often a jar of peanut butter and so
staff are never to offer Youth A peanut butter and Staff 1 asked Youth A if he wanted
soup or a peanut butter sandwich during this incident, which made Staff 3 feel that
Staff 1 was intentionally provoking Youth A. Staff 3 said Staff 1 will often engage in
power struggles with the youth in the facility, shows favoritism to certain youth, and
will call youth names such as “tubby”. Staff 3 said Staff 1 is very open about her
personal life and has told the youth about her break-up with her boyfriend, going to
jail for the night due to an assault on the boyfriend’s daughter, and not having a
place to live.
6

Therapist was interviewed via telephone on January 26, 2021. Therapist said
she is contracted by North Point Homes to do the youth’s therapy and was at the
facility on the afternoon and evening of January 18, 2021. Therapist said she was in
the office with Youth C and Staff 3 when she heard Staff 1 arguing with Youth A and
Youth B about dinner. Specifically, she heard Staff 1 telling Youth A and Youth B to
make something for themselves as she was not going to cook. Therapist said about
fifteen minutes after this argument she heard screaming coming from the kitchen.
Therapist said she stepped out of the staff office and into the hallway and looked
directly into the kitchen where Staff 1 was wiping soup off her face yelling at Youth A
who was yelling back at her. Therapist said Youth A was leaning against the counter
and Staff 1 approached him and slapped him on the face. Therapist said it appeared
as though Staff 1’s hand was partially closed in a fist. Therapist said Youth A then
grabbed Staff 1 and Therapist said it was at that time she ran back into the staff
office and called the police for assistance. Therapist said once she got off the phone
Youth A was upstairs, and Staff 1 was in the bathroom. Therapist said the police
interviewed the youth and staff and left. Therapist said she has seen Staff 1 create
power struggles with the youth at different times as well as curse while working.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.158 Discipline.
(2) An institution shall prohibit all cruel and severe
discipline, including any of the following:
(a) Any type of corporal punishment inflicted in any
manner.
ANALYSIS: It is determined that Staff 1 utilized corporal punishment on
Youth A from information gathered during interviews with Youth
A, Youth C, Staff 2, Staff 3, and Therapist who all reported Staff
1 slapped Youth A in the face. Staff 3 reported that Youth A had
a red mark on his face from the force of the slap. Staff 1
admitted to touching Youth A’s face however reported it was not
done with force and was done in a playful manner.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
ADDITIONAL FINDINGS:
INVESTIGATION:
7

Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C were all interviewed face to face at the facility
on January 25, 2021. All three youth report Staff 1 sharing personal information with
them. Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C all reported knowing about Staff 1’s boyfriend,
break-up, and assault with the boyfriend’s daughter. Youth B also reported having
conversations with Staff 1 where she shared additional information about being
homeless and not being paid enough by North Point Homes.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on January 25, 2021. Staff 2
said Staff 1 does not exhibit good boundaries with the youth and will often share a
lot of her personal life situations with the youth in the house, such as her break-up,
and financial struggles.
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on January 29, 2021. Staff 3 said Staff 1 is
very open about her personal life and has told the youth about her break-up with her
boyfriend, going to jail for the night due to an assault on the boyfriend’s daughter,
and not having a place to live.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff
qualifications.
(4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the
following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
(b) Experience to perform the duties of the position
assigned.
ANALYSIS: Staff 1 exhibited the inability to perform the duties of her position
assigned by her lack of professional boundaries, sharing her
personal information with the youth, as well as her engaging in a
power struggle with Youth A over food which is a trauma for him
which all staff were made aware of.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
8

Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, I recommend no change in the
license status.
